reference.text: winding or unwinding ropes or cables for feeding or storage purposes B65H; rope or cable winding or unwinding mechanisms for lifts B66B

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers:rope, cable or chain winding or unwinding mechanisms for moving all loads except lift cages, e.g. winches for dredges;braking or detent devices characterised by their application for retarding or preventing rotary movement of a winding drum or barrel

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
B66D1/395 covered by B66D1/36, B66D1/50
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Rope, cable, or chain winding mechanisms

reference.text: portable or mobile lifting or hauling appliances B66D3/00

title-part.text: Safety cranks for preventing unwanted crank rotation and subsequent lowering of the loads
Power transmissions between power sources and drums or barrels

reference.text: including brakes, one-way brakes, one-way clutches, clutches activated alternately with brakes, fixed ratio gearing unless otherwise provided for in B66D1/16 - B66D1/24

title-part.text: the drums or barrels being freely rotatable

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. having a clutch activated independently of a brake

reference.text: B66D1/20, B66D1/22, B66D1/24 take precedence; clutches activated alternately with brakes B66D1/14, slip couplings B66D1/14

title-part.text: and the power being transmitted from a continuously operating and irreversible prime mover

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. an internal combustion engine, e.g. on a motor vehicle or a portable winch

title-part.text: Chain, belt, or friction drives, e.g. incorporating sheaves

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. with planet gears having movable axes of rotation

title-part.text: for varying speed or reversing direction of rotation of drums or barrels

CPC-specific-text.text: , i.e. variable ratio or reversing gearing

title-part.text: Rope, cable, or chain drums or barrels
Attachment of ropes or cables to drums or barrels
Guiding, or otherwise ensuring winding in an orderly manner, of ropes, cables, or chains

CPC-specific-text.text: by means of pivotably mounted drums or barrels

title-part.text: by means of guides movable relative to drum or barrel
by means of axially-movable drums or barrels

reference.text: pivotably mounted drums or barrel B66D1/365

title-part.text: for maintaining predetermined rope, cable, or chain tension, e.g. in ropes or cables for towing craft, in chains for anchors
Warping or mooring winch-cable tension control
for varying rope or cable tension, e.g. when recovering craft from water
by means of a single rope or chain
driven through planetary or differential gearings

CPC-specific-text.text: having two or more drums providing tractive force
Friction drives, e.g. pulleys, having a cable winding angle of less than 360 degrees
drivable by both motor and manually
drivable by both motor and manually
Details concerning gearing arrangements, e.g. multi-speed
having a particular use, e.g. rope ascenders

title-part.text: having auxiliary drums or barrels for storing the ropes or cables
for shunting, e.g. in marshalling yards
for slewing and hoisting by means of derricks
Portable or mobile lifting or hauling appliances

CPC-specific-text.text: using two or more cooperating endless chains
Power actuated devices operating on ropes, cables, or chains for hauling in a mainly horizontal direction

title-part.text: Manually-operated, e.g. lever-actuated, devices operating on ropes, cables, or chains for hauling in a mainly horizontal direction
Pulley blocks or like devices in which force is applied to a rope, cable, or chain which passes over one or more pulleys, e.g. to obtain mechanical advantage

CPC-specific-text.text: Block and tackle system with variable number of cable parts

title-part.text: Applications of braking or detent devices
Chain or like hand-operated tackles with or without power transmission gearing between operating member and lifting rope, chain or cable
operated by an endless chain passing over a pulley or a sprocket
with driving motor, e.g. electric motor, and drum or barrel contained in a common housing
with variable-speed gearings between driving motor and drum or barrel
Braking or detent devices characterised by application to lifting or hoisting gear, e.g. for controlling the lowering of loads
Crane, lift hoist, or winch brakes operating on drums, barrels, or ropes
for action on ropes or cables
for generating braking forces which are proportional to the loads suspended
specially adapted for winding gear, e.g. in mining hoists
with devices for paying out or automatically tightening the cable
Actuated by chain, belt or by friction
Winches with multiple drums or with drums with multiple parts of different diameter
with adjacent drums mounted on a single shaft with a common coupling member
Details, e.g. winch drums, cooling, bearings, mounting, base structures, cable guiding or attachment of the cable to the drum
Cable guiding during winding or paying out
Pulleys, sheaves, pulley blocks or their mounting
Mechanisms with latches or braking devices in general for capstans, hoists or similar devices as well as braking devices actuated electrically or by fluid under pressure
Brakes with mechanisms with latches for hoists or similar devices
Brakes with axial thrust for winches, hoists or similar devices
